page.title: 01Education
page.content: Within The area, there are three schools. One school is owned by the Local Education Authority. It is Sleights Church Of England School. The others are run by the Order Of The Holy Paraclete based at Sneaton Castle. They are Woodlands and Carr Hall. Sleights C. Of E. takes 150 children aged 5-11. Woodlands takes children aged 5-11, mainly girls, but a few non-boarding boys. Carr Hall is the middle school run by the sisters, taking girls aged 11-14. The older children i.e. secondary age go to either Caedmon or Eskdale Schools, up until the age of 14, when they go to Whitby School up to 16 or 18 years.
